t: Why do I see so many virtually identical products under different brands when searching for products Amazon? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 2): Because they likely are identical products - the only thing different about them is the brand and perhaps the packaging. These private label products are likely all sourced from the same factory or group of factories, and the brand owners did not bother taking the time or effort...

t: Why do some products on Amazon look the same but have different brand names? - Quora
s: Answer: This is simple to answer. They look similar because the different brands are using the same supplier. This is ok but I suspect they are taking a generic product (like skin cream or headphones) but are not doing any modifications beyond putting their brand name on the product and packaging...

t: Generic items being sold as brands with brand registry from other products.
s: As a result of this issue, we now see an influx of Chinese sellers flooding the market with generic items. They create multiple listings undercutting each other daily with no regard for branding accuracy. Some even have review photos showing either no packaging at all or generic packaging.

t: Can another seller use my pictures on a similar listing?
s: When I add my listing, I can add additional photos of my product and a description of condition, but a buyer only sees these when they click on my listing from the available offers. The only time this process changes is when the product you have is your own brand, in which case you register that brand to protect against unscrupulous sellers trying to sell a similar ...
